First of all, we need to correlate the Eu 2+ site contribution and different emission center by considering local environments of activators. The Eu 2+ emission is dependent on the CFS. In general, when the average bond length ( d av) is shorter and the distortion indices ( D) is larger, then there will be a larger CFS
35 . The average bond lengths, d(Lu-O) and d(K2-O) in K 3LuSi 2O 7 are 2.22 Å and 2.77 Å, respectively. The distortion indices are 0 for both LuO 6 and K2O 6 polyhedron. Thus, we believe that the higher energy emission (719 nm) peak is associated with Eu 2+ occupying K2 sites, while the lower energy emission (784 nm) peak is attributed to Eu 2+ occupying Lu sites. The conclusions of the site occupation for Eu 2+ in K 3LuSi 2O 7 are consistent with the results in Rb 3YSi 2O 7:Eu 2+ phosphor reported by our group
31 .
